title: Enhancing Multimodal Entity and Relation Extraction with Variational Information Bottleneck. (arXiv:2304.02328v1 [cs.MM])
abstract: This paper studies the multimodal named entity recognition (MNER) and multimodal relation extraction (MRE), which are important for multimedia social platform analysis. The core of MNER and MRE lies in incorporating evident visual information to enhance textual semantics, where two issues inherently demand investigations. The first issue is modality-noise, where the task-irrelevant information in each modality may be noises misleading the task prediction. The second issue is modality-gap, where representations from different modalities are inconsistent, preventing from building the semantic alignment between the text and image. tldr: 本文提出了一个新颖的方法，通过信息瓶颈原理，细化-正则化器和变分信息瓶颈模型来解决多模态实体和关系提取中的模态噪声和模态差距问题，并实现了优异的性能。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a novel method, the Multi-Modal representation learning with Information Bottleneck (MMIB), to address the challenges of incorporating visual information into textual semantics for multimodal named entity recognition and multimodal relation extraction. By utilizing the information bottleneck principle, refinement-regularizer, and variational information bottleneck (VIB) model, the proposed method achieves excellent performance on multiple datasets.
